CatDescriptText: Cutline of related image published in Pittsburgh Courier newspaper, April 18, 1953, pg. 32 reads: "International Panel - Pictured above are some of the sons and daughters of other lands who will take part in "Symposium Musicale" at Wesley Center, Sunday, April 19, at 3:30 o'clock. They are, seated, left to right: Blanca Adrianzen Trece of Peru; Florinda Maddela of the Philippines; Alicia Fortier Ortiz of Puerto Rico.  Standing: Massoud Simrad of Iran; Alan McCurick of England; Haille Giorgis Workneh of Ethiopia; Phedon Ventouretos of Greece; Edwin Sterling of Belgium, and John Petrolias of Greece.  The Wesley Center Cathedral Choir is sponsoring the program. - Harris Photo."Cutline of related image published in Pittsburgh Courier newspaper, April 25, 1953, pg. 32 reads: "International Panel - This international panel discussed the theme: "Our Neighbors Speak" at Wesley Center Church last Sunday afternoon.  Kneeling, left to right, are Takehiho Matsudo of Tokyo, Japan, and Haile Giorgis Workneh of Ethiopia.  Standing are Miss Chung Wka Lee of Korea; A.O. Zaighum of Pakistan; Miss Alicia Fortier Ortiz of Puerto Rico; A.D. Gaither; Miss Florinda R. Maddela of the Philippines; Dr. Edwin Sterling of Carnegie Institute of Technology; Mr. Vaidyanathan of India; Alan McCririck of England; Miss Dorothy Chiavella of Pittsburgh; Patricio Grove of Chile, and Miss Blanca Adrianzen Treece of Lima, Peru.  Other participants, but not appearing in the picture, are Miss Margreth Stub of Norway; Nakhum Ayalon of Israel, and Ronald Dodsworth of England. - Harris Photos."
TitMainTitle: Group portrait, from left, seated: Blanca Adrianzen Trece, Florinda Maddela, and Alicia Fortier Ortiz, wearing ethnic costumes; standing: Massoud Simrad, Alan McCurick, Haille Giorgis Workneh, Phedon Ventouretos, Edwin Sterling, and John Petrolias, gathered in Wesley Center with patterned linoleum floor and square patterned curtains
